reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Cash assistance for vulnerable households affected by conflict

description.narrative:
The military offensive to recapture Hawiga city and surrounding areas from the control of Islamic State (IS) began in September 2017 and is expected to impact a population of 85,000 people. The area - primarily in Kirkuk governorate but reaching into Erbil, Ninewa, and Salah al-Din governorates - has been under the control of IS since June 2014. Since the Hawiga offensive began there has been increased displacement from Hawiga district into surrounding areas, with 7,000 people arriving in the first week. There are also many extremely vulnerable households who have remained in Hawiga district, rather than becoming displaced.
These arrivals add to the nearly 700,000 people are displaced in Kirkuk and Salah al Din governorates (IOM DTM Sept 2017). Many have been protractedly displaced for some years now, have exhausted their assets and are forced to employ negative coping mechanisms. This project will provide multi-purpose cash assistance to 714 conflict-affected households (approximately 3,856 individuals) in Kirkuk, Erbil, Ninewa and Salah al Din governorates with a focus on those from or in Hawiga district. It is anticipated that 409 households (approximately 2,209 individuals) will receive first-line cash assistance of a one-off monthly payment, and 305 households (approximately 1,647 individuals) receive second-line cash assistance consisting of either three multi-purpose cash payments over a period of 3 months, or 2 payments over 2 months for beneficiaries who have already received 1st line assistance.
Target beneficiary households include recently displaced vulnerable households in Kirkuk, Erbil, Ninewa and Salah al Din governorates, vulnerable households who have recently returned to newly accessible areas in Kirkuk governorate, and highly vulnerable households who have remained during the protracted occupation by IS and recent military offensive in Hawiga district, Kirkuk. Remainee households have not been displaced but many will be highly vulnerable without access to basic services.
This project will directly contribute to the multi-purpose cash assistance (MPCA) cluster objective as part of the IHPF Hawiga Reserve Allocation Strategy and the Hawgia Operational Plan to provide MPCA to meet urgent basic needs of vulnerable IDPs residing outside of camps. Activities will be carried out as a sequenced response in line with the 2017 HRP MPCA strategy, conducting activities that follow the 1st and 2nd line response strategies. The cash value of the transfer will be $400 per month, based upon the current CWG guidelines. As military operations in and around Hawiga continue, and new areas become accessible, markets will resume functionality and this project will enable extremely vulnerable households to access these markets, other local services, supporting them to better meet their basic needs.
